author: Dr. Lisa Park (ED)
note_text:
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
71 y/o female with history of CHF (EF 35%), HTN, CKD Stage 3. Presents with 4 days of progressive dyspnea and lower extremity edema. Reports 8lb weight gain over past week. Admits to dietary indiscretion (high sodium meals).

ED COURSE:
Patient arrived hypoxic (86% RA), placed on 4L NC with improvement to 91%. CXR shows bilateral pulmonary edema. BNP markedly elevated at 1250. Given IV Lasix 80mg with good urine output.

MEDICAL DECISION MAKING:
Acute on chronic diastolic CHF exacerbation with pulmonary edema.

Risk factors:
1. BNP >400 indicating significant volume overload
2. Hypoxia requiring supplemental oxygen
3. CKD complicating diuresis

PLAN:
Admit to Medicine (Inpatient).
Continue IV diuresis.
Daily weights, strict I/O.
Cardiology consult for optimization.
